title: Custom, or what?
content:
Some CEO dumps a logo on my desk and tells me to make a new one with an entirely different text but using the same font. Me: "Sure. So... what's this font?" Him: "How should I know? That's your job innit?"

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202130846im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo-bw_3579.gif)

It _could_ be a custom job; however, I rate that as unlikely, given the subtleties -- the left and right leg of the "U" are of slightly different widths, and the "N" has some surprising curves I just know I've seen before (perhaps Friz Quadratish?). OTOH, I'm not too wild about those "E" and "F"s. Still, I'd like to know.
author: Theunis de Jong

comments.content: Unfortunately, without a working image, we'll have to close this one down. Theunis, perhaps you can enlighten us - What did you end up finding?
